Package mini2

Class ArrayAdventures

java.lang.Object
mini2.ArrayAdventures
public class ArrayAdventures
extends java.lang.Object
Utilities for working with arrays.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • remove

      public static void remove​(int[] arr, int pos)
      Remove an element at index pos from the array. All elements to the right of the given position are shifted down, and the last cell of the array is filled with a zero. For example, if arr = [1, 10, 3, 5, 7], after invoking remove(arr, 2), arr should be [1, 10, 5, 7, 0]. If pos is out of bounds, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array from which to remove an element
      pos - the position at which the element should be removed

    • removeAndShiftUp

      public static void removeAndShiftUp​(int[] arr, int pos)
      Remove an element at index pos from the array. All elements to the left of the given position are shifted up, and the first cell of the array is filled with a zero. For example, if arr = [1, 10, 3, 5, 7], after invoking removeAndShiftUp(arr, 2), arr should be [0, 1, 10, 5, 7]. If pos is out of bounds, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array from which to remove an element
      pos - the position at which the element should be removed

    • removeOddElements

      public static void removeOddElements​(int[] arr)
      Removes all odd numbers from the array. You must maintain the order of all the remaining elements in the array and shift them down, and pad the array with zeros. For example, if arr = [1, -10, 3, 7, 4], after invoking removeOddElements(arr), arr should become [-10, 4, 0, 0, 0].
      Parameters:
      arr - the array from which to remove the selected elements

    • findRuns

      public static boolean[] findRuns​(int[] arr)
      Finds the runs in the given array and returns a boolean array of the same length indicating which elements are part of a run, where a run is defined as a sequence of three or more adjacent repeated values. For example, if arr = [6, 2, 5, 5, 5, 5, 4, 4, 5, 2, 2, 2, 1], then arr contains two runs, 5 5 5 5 and 2 2 2, and the method would return a boolean array [false, false, true, true, true, true, false, false, false, true, true, true, false].
      Parameters:
      arr - the array in which to find the runs
      Returns:
      a boolean array indicating the positions of the run(s)

    • removeRuns

      public static void removeRuns​(int[] arr)
      Removes all the runs in an array and then pads to the end of array with zeros, where a run is defined as a sequence of three or more adjacent repeated values. For example, if arr = [6, 2, 5, 5, 5, 5, 4, 4, 5, 2, 2, 2, 1], then arr contains two runs, 5 5 5 5 and 2 2 2, and after invoking removeRuns(arr) the resulting array would be [6, 2, 4, 4, 5, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
      Parameters:
      arr - the array from which to remove the runs

    • toString1D

      public static java.lang.String toString1D​(int[] arr)
      Returns a string representation of the given 2D array. The format is demonstrated below. Each value is formated with a minimum width of 7 characters, for example, String.format("%7d", value);

      Example output: 

       {      5,     56, 234235,   9867}
      Parameters:
      arr - the given array
      Returns:
      a string representation of the given array

    • toString2D

      public static java.lang.String toString2D​(int[][] arr)
      Extra Credit (5 Points)

      Returns a string representation of the given 2D array. The format is demonstrated below.

      Example output: 

       {{      5,     56, 234235,   9867},
  {    262,  39485,    -10,     78},
  {     56,      1,   9837,   8712},
  {     87,    -25,      0,   9820}}
      Parameters:
      arr - the given array
      Returns:
      a string representation of the given array

    • swapRows

      public static void swapRows​(int[][] arr, int row1, int row2)
      Extra Credit (5 Points)

      Exchanges the elements of one row with those in a different row in a given 2D array. Each element remains in the same column. Assumes that all rows are the same length and row indexes are in bounds.

      Parameters:
      arr - the array whose rows should be exchanged
      row1 - one of the rows to swap
      row2 - other row to swap

    • isIncreasing

      public static boolean isIncreasing​(int[] values, int[] indexes)
      Extra Credit (5 Points)

      Returns true if the given array of indexes represent values in an increasing order.

      The elements of the array indexes are indented to be used as indexes into the array values.

      For example, if values={44, 70, 28, 91, 10} and indexes={0, 1, 2} then the selected values are {44, 70, 28}. These values are not in increasing order so the method returns false.

      On the other hand, if indexes={4, 2, 3} the selected values are {10, 28, 91}. These values are in increasing order so the method return true.

      Assumes that all indexes are in bounds of the values array. If indexes is empty the method returns true.

      Parameters:
      values - an array of values
      indexes - an array of element that are to be
      Returns:
      a string representation of the given array
